Description:
Functional Features:The object shown in the image is an electric reach truck designed for pallet handling, stacking, and high-level storage operations in warehouse logistics systems. Its primary function is to transport palletized goods efficiently between ground level and medium-to-high rack positions within narrow aisles. This type of equipment is widely used in automated warehouses, high-density storage facilities, distribution centers, and smart manufacturing workshops. In simulation and digital twin environments, it is commonly employed for forklift navigation, task scheduling, human–machine collaboration studies, and the validation of autonomous control and perception algorithms. The reach mechanism allows the forks to extend forward without moving the entire vehicle, improving flexibility and safety during high-rack operations.
Visual Features:Visually, the forklift features a compact yet vertically oriented structure, consisting of a tall mast, extendable forks, and an integrated vehicle body. The dominant color scheme includes dark gray and black, complemented by a bright yellow side panel that enhances visibility and conveys industrial safety cues. The mast and forks are made of metal with matte-painted or powder-coated surface finishes to improve durability and corrosion resistance. Exterior panels appear smooth and minimal, likely made of engineering plastics or coated metal, giving the equipment a robust, functional, and professional industrial appearance suitable for simulation-oriented digital assets.

Tag:
Model:  Counterbalance Forklift
Manufacturer:   LESTAK LOGISTICS
Function:Transporting, Lifting
DNA:DB(k)
Scale:0.01
Description:
Functional Features:The object shown in the image is a sit-down counterbalance forklift designed for loading, transporting, and stacking palletized goods. Its primary function is to handle medium to heavy loads efficiently in industrial and logistics environments, using a rear counterweight to offset the moment generated during lifting operations and maintain vehicle stability. This type of forklift is commonly used in manufacturing plants, warehouses, distribution centers, and semi-outdoor facilities where robust performance and operational flexibility are required. In digital twin and simulation platforms, counterbalance forklifts are frequently adopted as baseline models to represent conventional manually operated equipment, supporting studies on workflow optimization, path planning, and human–machine interaction.
Visual Features:Visually, the forklift features a compact yet solid structure with a classic industrial vehicle layout, including a front mast with forks, a central operator cabin, and a rear-mounted power and counterweight unit. The color scheme is dominated by blue and black, creating a strong industrial contrast that enhances functional differentiation and visibility. The mast and forks are made of high-strength metal and finished with matte paint or powder coating to improve wear resistance and corrosion protection. Exterior panels and covers appear smooth and minimal, likely composed of coated metal or engineering plastics, giving the equipment a durable, practical, and function-oriented industrial appearance.
